schema.description: Array of data entries. Each element corresponds to a security list. Use this value for a `listId` parameter in subsequent operations.

createdBy.description: Author of the list.

createdDate.description: ISO 8601 timestamp of the list creation.

description.description: A description for the security list.

id.description: A unique identifier for each security list.

listType.description: The list type. See [List types](https://techdocs.akamai.com/etp-config/reference/list-types) for details on supported values.

securityCategoryId.description: A unique identifier for the security category.

securityCategoryInfo.description: Contains data about the security category.

id.description: A unique identifier for the security category.

name.description: The name of the security category.

schema.description: The problem indicated by the error response from the SIA Config API.

detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to the problem.

errors.description: A list of HTTP problem details. The error response includes this list if there are several problems with a single request, to call out each of them separately.

instance.description: The URI for this error occurrence.

status.description: The HTTP status code generated by the origin server.

title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem type.

type.description: A URI reference that identifies the problem type.

schema.description: Sinkhole details.

activationCodeExpiry.description: Time in seconds the `activationCode` is valid.

aliases.description: Aliased name of the security connector.

createdBy.description: The user who created the security connector.

createdDate.description: Date of security connector creation.

description.description: The description of the security connector.

id.description: A unique identifier for each security connector.

lastCommunication.description: Number of seconds since last communication with the security connector occurred.

modifiedBy.description: User that modified the security connector.

name.description: The name of the security connector.

id.description: Unique identifier of the policy.

status.description: Status info of the security connector.

availableSoftwareVersion.description: The software version of the security connector.

connectionStatus.description: Connection status of the security connector, either `DISCONNECTED` or `CONNECTED`.

status.description: The activation status of the security connector, either `ACTIVE`, `INACTIVE`, or `ACTIVATION_IN_PROGRESS`.

supportedUntil.description: Number of seconds remaining in a security connector's support period.

uuid.description: Unique identifier for the security connector.

version.description: The version number of the security connector.

get.description: Provides a list of client versions.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Secure Internet Access Configuration API

schema.description: Lists client version details.

items.description: Lists client version detail object parameters.

approvalStatus.description:
Identifies the version approval status. Either `PENDING`, `APPROVED_ON_DEMAND`, or `APPROVED_FORCE_UPGRADE`. 
`APPROVED_ON_DEMAND` means the client version can be upgraded on-demand.
`APPROVED_FORCE_UPGRADE` means the admin has forced an upgrade to this client version.

autoupgradeEnabled.description: Enables auto upgrade for the version.

osId.description: The unique identifier of the OS installed on client version.

osName.description: The name of OS installed on client.

releaseStatus.description: The status of the version release.

sha256.description: The SHA-256 representation of the version.

supportedUntil.description: The date of expiry of the version.

versionId.description: The unique identifier of the version.

versionName.description: The name of the specified version.

get.description: Provides a list of client devices and its details.

200.description: The response provides either JSON or CSV data.

schema.description: List of client devices with details.

items.description: Details of client device, such as software installed and errors.

blacklist.description: Blocks the device from the network.

deviceOwnerId.description: Unique identifier for the owner of the device.

id.description: Unique identifier for the client device.

originalId.description: Unique identifier for the device by a secondary system.

os.description: Name of operating system of the device.

osVer.description: Version of the operating system of the device.

registeredTime.description: Timestamp marking when the client device was registered on the network. The value is expressed in epoch seconds.

reportedState.description: Last reported status of the device.

reportedTime.description: ISO 8601 timestamp marking the last report of the device on network.

user.description: Name of user of the device.

patternDetails.description:
Specified quantity of both credit or debit card numbers and of associated phrases such as:-
* "csv"
* "Expiry Date"
* "Bankleitzahl"
* "American Express"
* "handelsbanken"

For a definition of credit card numbers that are detected please see the CCL description for "Credit card numbers [Universal]".
patternDetails.name: Credit card numbers - with phrases [Universal]

patternDetails.description:
Credit, debit, travel, store or membership card numbers using a common bank identification numbering system. Such as:-
* 16 digit card numbers (including MasterCard and VISA)
* American Express
* CUP (China Union Pay)
* Diners Club
* Itaú Unibanco
* JCB
* Maestro
* Royal Bank of Canada
* ScotiBank
* Verve
* magnetic track data containing card numbers

Card numbers must conform to the following:-
* Start with a "3", "4", "5" or "6" i.e. be a standard format ISO/IEC 7812 number with a Major Industry Identifier (MII) for 'Travel and entertainment', 'Banking and financial' or 'Merchandising and banking/financial'.
* If not 16 digits then start with a recognised Issuer Identification Number (IIN)
* Have an appropriate length for the card issuer
* Either be contiguous or have an appropriate digit grouping for the issuer
* Any digit groupings to be separated by a white space " ", dash "-" or dash variant
* Have a valid Luhn check digit
* Must not appear to be part of a larger digit sequence

NOTE: Card numbers used for other non-financial purposes but that use the same format as monetary cards will be detected as credit cards. This is because:- 
* These cards typically have high PII risk
* Loyalty cards (etc.) often do have an actual financial value or financial consequence
* Card issuers have been known to upgrade loyalty & travel cards to have a financial value
patternDetails.name: Credit card numbers [Universal]

patternDetails.description:
Card magnetic track 2 data according to the ISO/IEC 7813 specification.

This detection is included within the CCL "Credit card numbers [Global]". 
This CCL is provided as an optional level of granularity.
patternDetails.name: Credit card magnetic track 2 [Universal]

patternDetails.description:
Card magnetic track 1 data according to the ISO/IEC 7813 specification.

This detection is included in the CCL "Credit card numbers [Global]". 
This CCL is provided as an optional level of granularity.
patternDetails.name: Credit card magnetic track 1 [Universal]

patternDetails.description:
Specified quantity of both credit or debit card numbers and of associated phrases such as:-
* "csv"
* "Expiry Date"
* "Bankleitzahl"
* "American Express"
* "handelsbanken"

For a definition of credit card numbers that are detected please see the CCL description for "Credit card numbers [Universal]".
patternDetails.name: Credit card numbers - with phrases [Universal]

patternDetails.description:
Credit, debit, travel, store or membership card numbers using a common bank identification numbering system. Such as:-
* 16 digit card numbers (including MasterCard and VISA)
* American Express
* CUP (China Union Pay)
* Diners Club
* Itaú Unibanco
* JCB
* Maestro
* Royal Bank of Canada
* ScotiBank
* Verve
* magnetic track data containing card numbers

Card numbers must conform to the following:-
* Start with a "3", "4", "5" or "6" i.e. be a standard format ISO/IEC 7812 number with a Major Industry Identifier (MII) for 'Travel and entertainment', 'Banking and financial' or 'Merchandising and banking/financial'.
* If not 16 digits then start with a recognised Issuer Identification Number (IIN)
* Have an appropriate length for the card issuer
* Either be contiguous or have an appropriate digit grouping for the issuer
* Any digit groupings to be separated by a white space " ", dash "-" or dash variant
* Have a valid Luhn check digit
* Must not appear to be part of a larger digit sequence

NOTE: Card numbers used for other non-financial purposes but that use the same format as monetary cards will be detected as credit cards. This is because:- 
* These cards typically have high PII risk
* Loyalty cards (etc.) often do have an actual financial value or financial consequence
* Card issuers have been known to upgrade loyalty & travel cards to have a financial value
patternDetails.name: Credit card numbers [Universal]

patternDetails.description:
Card magnetic track 2 data according to the ISO/IEC 7813 specification.

This detection is included within the CCL "Credit card numbers [Global]". 
This CCL is provided as an optional level of granularity.
patternDetails.name: Credit card magnetic track 2 [Universal]

patternDetails.description:
Card magnetic track 1 data according to the ISO/IEC 7813 specification.

This detection is included in the CCL "Credit card numbers [Global]". 
This CCL is provided as an optional level of granularity.
patternDetails.name: Credit card magnetic track 1 [Universal]

schema.description: Provides global settings details.

chinaDeploymentStatus.description:
The status of the China region deployment. 
Possible values are: `STAGING`, `PENDING`, `BUILDING`, `RUNNING`, `COMPLETED`, `CONTENT_EXTERNAL`, `REVERTING`, `FAILED`, or `ABORTED`.

createdBy.description: Name of the user who created this global setting.

createdDate.description: ISO 8601 timestamp this global setting's creation.

enableChinaRegion.description: Enables the China region for the deployment.

globalSettingsId.description: Unique ID of the global setting.

modifiedBy.description: The user who modified this global setting.

modifiedDate.description: ISO 8601 timestamp marking this global setting's last modification.

sourceIpBindCidrs.description: List of IP CIDRs available for `sourceIpBind`.

ETag.description:
Use the `ETag` string returned in the response header as `If-Match` in write requests to avoid overwriting edits by any other API clients. 
See [Concurrency control](https://techdocs.akamai.com/etp-config/reference/concurrency-control) for details.

type.description: The list item type, either `LIST_TYPE_IP` for an IP address, or `LIST_TYPE_DOMAIN` for a domain.

value.description: The IP address or domain of the list item.

totalCount.description: The total number of list items.

example.description:
Specified quantity of both credit or debit card numbers and of associated phrases such as:-
* "csv"
* "Expiry Date"
* "Bankleitzahl"
* "American Express"
* "handelsbanken"

For a definition of credit card numbers that are detected please see the CCL description for "Credit card numbers [Universal]".
example.name: Credit card numbers - with phrases [Universal]

example.description:
Credit, debit, travel, store or membership card numbers using a common bank identification numbering system. Such as:-
* 16 digit card numbers (including MasterCard and VISA)
* American Express
* CUP (China Union Pay)
* Diners Club
* Itaú Unibanco
* JCB
* Maestro
* Royal Bank of Canada
* ScotiBank
* Verve
* magnetic track data containing card numbers

Card numbers must conform to the following:-
* Start with a "3", "4", "5" or "6" i.e. be a standard format ISO/IEC 7812 number with a Major Industry Identifier (MII) for 'Travel and entertainment', 'Banking and financial' or 'Merchandising and banking/financial'.
* If not 16 digits then start with a recognised Issuer Identification Number (IIN)
* Have an appropriate length for the card issuer
* Either be contiguous or have an appropriate digit grouping for the issuer
* Any digit groupings to be separated by a white space " ", dash "-" or dash variant
* Have a valid Luhn check digit
* Must not appear to be part of a larger digit sequence

NOTE: Card numbers used for other non-financial purposes but that use the same format as monetary cards will be detected as credit cards. This is because:- 
* These cards typically have high PII risk
* Loyalty cards (etc.) often do have an actual financial value or financial consequence
* Card issuers have been known to upgrade loyalty & travel cards to have a financial value
example.name: Credit card numbers [Universal]

example.description:
Card magnetic track 2 data according to the ISO/IEC 7813 specification.

This detection is included within the CCL "Credit card numbers [Global]". 
This CCL is provided as an optional level of granularity.
example.name: Credit card magnetic track 2 [Universal]

example.description:
Card magnetic track 1 data according to the ISO/IEC 7813 specification.

This detection is included in the CCL "Credit card numbers [Global]". 
This CCL is provided as an optional level of granularity.
example.name: Credit card magnetic track 1 [Universal]

title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem type.

type.description: A URI reference that identifies the problem type.

mode.description:
The DNS over TLS mode:
- `ATTEMPT` always tries to use DOT and falls back to standard DNS when unavailable.
- `REQUIRED` requires DOT and informs the client the device isn't protected.
- `DISABLED` doesn't apply DOT to secure DNS traffic.

applications.description: MobileIron is a mobile device management (MDM) system that provides ITS with a means of governing mobile access to WCM resources, including email, calendar, contacts, and other central applications.
applications.name: Mobileiron

risk.description: Indicates the application has the lowest amount of risk for data loss or a security breach. These applications allow users to perform low-risk actions such as viewing content, listening to music, downloading files,  and more.
risk.name: Low

applications.description: ZipShare is a web application that users can upload, share files which the files are zipped using WinZip's legendary compression, making them faster to download and saving bandwidth.
applications.name: ZipShare

risk.description: Indicates the application is extremely at risk for data loss or a security breach. These applications allow users to perform high-risk actions such as sending or sharing files and making remote connections that can bypass enterprise security.
risk.name: Very High

risk.description: Indicates the application is slightly at risk for data loss or a security breach. These applications allow users to perform slightly risky actions such as voting, rate scoring, text searches, translation, and more.

mode.description:
The DNS over TLS mode:
- `ATTEMPT` always tries to use DOT and falls back to standard DNS when unavailable.
- `REQUIRED` requires DOT and informs the client the device isn't protected.
- `DISABLED` doesn't apply DOT to secure DNS traffic.

schema.description: Contains data about a TLS certificate.

caMode.description: Mode of the certificate, either `CUSTOMER` or `AKAMAI`.

certificate.description: Value of the certificate in PEM format. ASCII, base64-encoded text starting with `-----BEGIN CERTIFICATE-----` and ending with `-----END CERTIFICATE-----`.

certificateId.description: A unique identifier for each certificate.

certificateRequest.description: Value for the certificate signing request (CSR). ASCII, base64-encoded text starting with `-----BEGIN CERTIFICATE REQUEST-----` and ending with `-----END CERTIFICATE REQUEST-----`.

createdBy.description: Name of the user who created this certificate.

createdDate.description: ISO 8601 timestamp marking the certificate's creation.

expiredDate.description: ISO 8601 timestamp marking the certificate's expiration.

issuedDate.description: ISO 8601 timestamp marking the certificate's issue.

modifiedBy.description: Name of the user who most recently modified this certificate. If there haven't been any modifications, the value matches `createdBy`.

modifiedDate.description: ISO 8601 timestamp marking this certificate's last modification. If there haven't been any modifications, the value matches `createdDate`.

status.description: The certificate's deployment status. Either `CREATING`, `UPDATING`, `PENDING_DOWNLOAD`, `PENDING_DISTRIBUTION`, `PENDING_ACTIVATION`, `ACTIVATING`, `ACTIVATED`, `DEACTIVATING`, `DEACTIVATED`, `EXPIRED` or `INCOMPLETE`.
